sourcesContent: // ** React Imports import { Fragment, useEffect } from 'react' // ** Third Party Components import Prism from 'prismjs' // ** Reactstrap Imports import { Row, Col, CardText } from 'reactstrap' // ** Demo Components import DropdownFlat from './DropdownFlat' import DropdownBasic from './DropdownBasic' import DropdownSplit from './DropdownSplit' import DropdownSizes from './DropdownSizes' import DropdownOutline from './DropdownOutline' import DropdownGradient from './DropdownGradient' import DropdownDirections from './DropdownDirections' import DropdownVariations from './DropdownVariations' import DropdownControlled from './DropdownControlled' import DropdownUncontrolled from './DropdownUncontrolled' // ** Custom Components import Card from '@components/card-snippet' import BreadCrumbs from '@components/breadcrumbs' // ** Source Code import { dropdownFlat, dropdownBasic, dropdownSizes, dropdownSplit, dropdownOutline, dropdownGradient, dropdownDirections, dropdownVariations, dropdownControlled, dropdownUncontrolled } from './DropdownsSourceCode' const Dropdowns = () => { useEffect(() => { Prism.highlightAll() }, []) return ( If you want to use controlled dropdown you'll have to manage state for it. With uncontrolled dropdown you won't have to manage state. Use class .dropdown-toggle-split and add a split button within your dropdown to create a dropdownSplit Use .outline attribute with button to create outline dropdown. Use class color="flat-*" to create a flat dropdown. Use class btn-gradient-* to create a gradient dropdown. Use class .btn-[lg/sm] to create a small or large dropdown. You can use drop from different direction to use drop from bottom right use right prop with your dropdown-menu. for drop directions use direction=[up/start/end] To create a dropdown with groups you can use prop header for the header of groups and for separation of group you can use prop divider. To create a dropdown with icons use class .dropdown-icon-wrapper with your dropdown. ) } export default Dropdowns
